article:
It was my first day at school. I felt 11 _ and scared. I went to all my classes with no friends. I felt no one really   cared for   me. I listened anxiously to all the lessons and waited for the lunch break. Then finally the bell   _  . It was time to get free of the uneasy atmosphere. 
During the lunch I met a new friend who wore a hat, and   _   I am Jewish , we got along well, and I was so   _   when she said, "Sit with us, at our table." She   _     to the one next to the door. 
So I   _  , and took my tray and was about to walk with her   _   the floor, when suddenly I felt a nudge. "Hey, I saw you on the bus," said a   _   girl in a long skirt. "I    _   your Jewish star necklace. You should sit with us."
At that moment I   _   around, and to my surprise, I   _   the nations of the world, isolated themselves. The Spanish only sat with Spanish, the Hindus   _   with Hindus, the Russians with the Russians, and   _   the Arabs with the Jews. That's what I saw   _   my own eyes.
Suddenly, I saw the reason why wars got started in the world. Everyone   _   to their own kind. The lunchroom was a   _   of the world. Why was everyone so   _  ? I was puzzled. 
But I wanted a change. Determinedly, I turned   _   this tall girl, and went with my new friend. There was no enmity  in the room. I felt relaxed. I built a   _   between two worlds when I sat with those different from me. The whole world should get close, not apart.
